result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abdel Perez-Andino

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Abdel Perez-Andino appeared by video.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse appeared by video for Abdel Perez-Andino.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter:  Sarah Chwaszczewski. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Tsz-King Tse has not received discovery and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1. This hearing will be heard via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Abdel Perez-Andino in court.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse appeared by phone for Abdel Perez-Andino.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 089609,
Payable Number: 1033467,
Receipt Number: 22RP037818,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/26/22 @ 2p
